title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.89 - Executive Order No. 89: Extending the period for paying real property taxes without interest in certain school districts, due to a disaster emergency. [*][DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.89 - Executive Order No. 89: Extending the period for paying real property taxes without interest in certain school districts, due to a disaster emergency. [*][DAGGER]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on September 7, 1998 and continuing, severe thunderstorms with high winds and significant rain came through New York

State and caused widespread power outages and disrupted vital public
transportation and public safety systems within Cayuga, Fulton, Madison, Monroe, Montgomery, Oneida, Onondaga, Oswego and Wayne Counties and contiguous
areas; WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
damage to residential and commercial property, and it continues to pose a
threat to the public health and safety; WHEREAS, by Executive Order Number 88 I declared a State

Disaster Emergency in the affected counties, and directed State agencies to
respond as necessary to assist those affected counties in restoring vital
public transportation systems and to provide such other assistance as necessary
to protect the public health and safety; WHEREAS, real property taxes for the 1998-1999 school year
are currently due in the affected counties; WHEREAS, by virtue of section
1322
of
the Real Property Tax Law, the date by which such taxes would have been payable
without interest is September 30, 1998; WHEREAS, such taxes would normally be subject to interest
if paid after that date; WHEREAS, section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, as added by

Chapter 389 of the Laws of 1997, authorizes the Governor to issue an Executive

Order during a State Disaster Emergency, extending the period for paying real
property taxes without interest by up to seven days in a county, city, town, village or school district in the affected area, if the Chief Executive Officer
of the county, city, town, village, or school district requests such an
extension; WHEREAS, a request for such an extension was received from
the Chief Executive Officer of the East Syracuse-Minoa Central School District, Jordan Elbridge Central School District, Weedsport Central School District, Liverpool Central School District, North Syracuse Central School District, Fayetteville-Manlius School District, Lyncourt Union Free School District, Baldwinsville Central School District, Central Square Central Schools, Chittenango Central Schools, LaFayette Central School District, Morrisville-Eaton Central School System, Sherburne-Earlville Central School

District, Stockbridge Valley Central School District, Clinton Central School

District, New Hartford Central School District, New York Mills Union Free

School District, Remsen Central School District, Vernon Verona Sherrill Central

School District, Waterville Central School District, Town of Webb Union Free

School District and Gloversville Enlarged School District; and
WHEREAS, given the hardships facing the people of Cayuga, Fulton, Madison, Monroe, Montgomery, Oneida, Onondaga, Oswego and Wayne

Counties and contiguous areas as a result of the September 7, 1998 storm, such
an extension is warranted; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby
extend by seven days the period for paying without interest the real property
taxes for the 1998-1999 school year that are currently due in the East

Syracuse-Minoa Central School District, Jordan Elbridge Central School

District, Weedsport Central School District, Liverpool Central School District, North Syracuse Central School District, Fayetteville-Manlius School District, Lyncourt Union Free School District, Baldwinsville Central School District, Central Square Central Schools, Chittenango Central Schools, LaFayette Central

School District, Morrisville-Eaton Central School System, Sherburne-Earlville

Central School District, Stockbridge Valley Central School District, Clinton

Central School District, New Hartford Central School District, New York Mills

Union Free School District, Remsen Central School District, Vernon Verona

Sherrill Central School District, Waterville Central School District, Town of

Webb Union Free School District and Gloversville Enlarged School District so
that such taxes shall be payable without interest through October 7, 1998; and
FURTHER, by virtue of the same section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, any taxes
not paid by such date shall be subject to the same penalties and interest that
would have applied if no such extension had been granted. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: September 24, 1998

Executive Order No. 89.1
*
[DAGGER]
Extending the period for paying real property taxes
without interest in certain school districts, due to a disaster
emergency. WHEREAS, beginning on September 7, 1998 and continuing, severe thunderstorms with high winds and significant rain came through New York

State and caused widespread power outages and disrupted vital public
transportation and public safety systems within Cayuga, Fulton, Madison, Monroe, Montgomery, Oneida, Onondaga, Oswego and Wayne Counties and contiguous
areas; WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
damage to residential and commercial property, and it continues to pose a
threat to the public health and safety; WHEREAS, by Executive Order Number 88 I declared a State

Disaster Emergency in the affected counties, and directed State agencies to
respond as necessary to assist those affected counties in restoring vital
public transportation systems and to provide such other assistance as necessary
to protect the public health and safety; WHEREAS, real property taxes for the 1998-1999 school year
are currently due in the affected counties; WHEREAS, by virtue of section
1322
of
the Real Property Tax Law, the date by which such taxes would have been payable
without interest is on or about September 30, 1998; WHEREAS, such taxes would normally be subject to interest
if paid after that date; WHEREAS, section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, as added by

Chapter 389 of the Laws of 1997, authorizes the Governor to issue an Executive

Order during a State Disaster Emergency, extending the period for paying real
property taxes without interest by up to seven days in a county, city, town, village or school district in the affected area, if the Chief Executive Officer
of the county, city, town, village, or school district requests such an
extension; WHEREAS, a request for such an extension was received from
the Chief Executive Officer of the East Syracuse-Minoa Central School District, Jordan Elbridge Central School District, Weedsport Central School District, Liverpool Central School District, North Syracuse Central School District, Fayetteville-Manlius School District, Lyncourt Union Free School District, Baldwinsville Central School District, Central Square Central Schools, Chittenango Central Schools, LaFayette Central School District, Morrisville-Eaton Central School System, Sherburne-Earlville Central School

District, Stockbridge Valley Central School District, Clinton Central School

District, New Hartford Central School District, New York Mills Union Free

School District, Remsen Central School District, Vernon Verona Sherrill Central

School District, Waterville Central School District, Town of Webb Union Free

School District and Gloversville Enlarged School District; and
WHEREAS, given the hardships facing the people of Cayuga, Fulton, Madison, Monroe, Montgomery, Oneida, Onondaga, Oswego and Wayne

Counties and contiguous areas as a result of the September 7, 1998 storm, such
an extension is warranted; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby
extend by seven days the period for paying without interest the real property
taxes for the 1998-1999 school year that are currently due in the East

Syracuse-Minoa Central School District, Jordan Elbridge Central School

District, Weedsport Central School District, Liverpool Central School District, North Syracuse Central School District, Fayetteville-Manlius School District, Lyncourt Union Free School District, Baldwinsville Central School District, Central Square Central Schools, Chittenango Central Schools, LaFayette Central

School District, Morrisville-Eaton Central School System, Sherburne-Earlville

Central School District, Stockbridge Valley Central School District, Clinton

Central School District, New Hartford Central School District, New York Mills

Union Free School District, Remsen Central School District, Vernon Verona

Sherrill Central School District, Waterville Central School District, Town of

Webb Union Free School District and Gloversville Enlarged School District so
that such taxes shall be payable without interest up to and including the
seventh day after the date that said taxes would otherwise be due without
interest; and
FURTHER, by virtue of the same section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, any taxes
not paid by such date shall be subject to the same penalties and interest that
would have applied if no such extension had been granted. Executive Order No. 89 dated September 24, 1998 is
superceded by this Executive Order. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: September 29, 1998

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
